turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about ZootFly.
turn.2: Even the game footage trailers posted to YouTube were removed after Sony Pictures Entertainment requested their deletion because of their unlicensed nature.
turn.3: Did the program eventually get cancelled?
turn.4: While ZootFly's title had died early in development, it helped spur interest in a game based on the "Ghostbusters" franchise and a , already under development at Terminal Reality, was bolstered by ZootFly's failed title.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Mark Randel, co-founder and head of Terminal Reality, was interviewed by Official Xbox Magazine and in that interview stated that ""What Zootfly did for us, inadvertently, is help sell the concept.
turn.7: How did it help sell the concept?
turn.8: When their footage came out, we were close to our green-light meeting, and when the executives saw the reaction from the fans, they immediately knew, 'Hey, Ghostbusters is going to be a big hit – we need to put this game into production."'" TimeO, another title developed by the same team as ZootFly's "Ghostbusters" game, dropped off the radar for several years.
turn.9: Why did it drop off the radar?
turn.10: First announced soon after the Ghostbusters prototype, it went months with little in the way of press coverage after the first flurries of activity related to its announcement.
turn.11: Did the program ever get cancelled?
turn.12: The original official web site (www.timeogame.com) went over a year without being updated before disappearing completely.
